body:
`Apply Alert filter to modify Confidence to 'False Positive'`
That changes the alerts that have already been raised, it will not necessarily affect new alerts.
Can you check to make sure that the alert filter is really changing the alerts?

hi @psiinon 
Yup, it was the case till 2.15.0.
In our process, the the filters are applied before the scan takes place.

Here is the response from org.zaproxy.clientapi.gen.Alert#alerts on 2.15.0
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0029d4b7-abae-443d-84ab-7d06dd461e89)

Here is the response from 2.16.0 on exactly the same app, where exactly the same alert filters are applied
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/463bd819-4697-44bc-887a-06d68dc39ae3)

As you can see the risk remains 'High' in 2.16.0. It is updated to 'Informational' on 2.15.0
Were you able to try with a recent weekly release?

@thc202 Just tried it out with _zaproxy/zaproxy:20250311-weekly_
There is no change. The alert risk still remains _high_ as in 2.16.0
Please provide the script that is raising the alert.
Thanks, I just wanted to test a few things when I realized it was a script rule.
Could you add a screenshot of the filter config?
This is not an add-on issue.

issue.title: Automation framework: Exit status job does not take into account False Positive confidence

labels.name: in:automation
labels.description: Issues pertaining to Automation Framework add-on.

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
### Describe the bug:

The exit status job does not take into account alert filter job when error level is set to "high" and all alerts with risk "high" changed to "false positive".



### Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Create automation via UI or via yaml with alertFilter and exitStatus job with the following configuration:
```
jobs:
 # add jobs e.g. passiveScan-config
  - name: Alert Filters
    type: alertFilter
    alertFilters:
      - ruleId: 6
        ruleName: Path Traversal
        newRisk: False Positive
        url: <url>
        methods:
          - GET
    parameters:
      deleteGlobalAlerts: true
  - name: Fetch Open API
    type: openapi
    parameters:
      apiUrl: https://dev.connect.uni-eng.de/v3/api-docs
      targetUrl: https://dev.connect.uni-eng.de/
      context: Authentication Context
      user: produser
  # add jobs e.g. passiveScan or spider to get alerts
  - type: exitStatus
    parameters:
      errorLevel: High
      warnExitValue: 0
      errorExitValue: 1
```
2. Run automation to find alerts.
3. The found alert is filtered out and is not shown in alert tab (UI) or in report later on.
4.  Alerts of type "Path Traversal" will be changed to risk "False Positive"
5. Exit status fails with exit code 1 with message "An alert has been raised with a risk of at least: High"

### Expected behavior:

Exit status should take into account alert filters (or also global filters).

### Software versions:

ZAP Version 2.16.0
Automation Framework Version 0.47.0

### Screenshots:

_No response_

### Errors from the zap.log file:

_No response_

### Additional context:

_No response_

### Would you like to help fix this issue?

- [ ] Yes

body:

```

An alert has been raised with a risk of at least: medium
Job exitStatus finished, time taken: 00:00:00

	An alert has been raised with a risk of at least: medium
Error: ZAP exited with error: Error: The process '/usr/local/bin/docker' failed with exit code 1
```

</details>

<details>
<summary>**zap-plan.yaml:**</summary>

```yaml
# ZAP Automation Framework Plan
# This file defines the automated security testing (DAST) workflow for the API
# Docs(ZAP Automation Framework): https://www.zaproxy.org/docs/automate/automation-framework/

# Docs(env): https://www.zaproxy.org/docs/desktop/addons/automation-framework/environment/
env:
  # Contexts define the scope of the scan
  contexts:
    - name: API Context
      urls:
        - https://project.com/
  parameters:
    failOnError: true
    progressToStdout: true

jobs:
  # Docs(passiveScan-config): https://www.zaproxy.org/docs/desktop/addons/automation-framework/job-pscanconf/
  # FYI: Needs to be run before openapi/activeScan/passiveScan-wait
  - type: passiveScan-config
    rules:
      # https://www.zaproxy.org/docs/alerts/
      # Disable passive browser-specific rules
      # threshold: off means the rule is disabled  it won't trigger, scan, or generate any alerts.
      # NOTE: Passive rules have to be added both in passiveScan-config and alertFilter
      - id: 10017   # X-Permitted-Cross-Domain-Policies Header Missing
        threshold: off
      - id: 10020   # X-Frame-Options Header Not Set
        threshold: off
      - id: 10021 # X-Content-Type-Options Header Missing
        threshold: off
      - id: 10038   # Content Security Policy (CSP) Header Not Set
        threshold: off
      - id: 10055   # X-Content-Type-Options Header Missing
        threshold: off
      - id: 90004 # Insufficient Site Isolation Against Spectre Vulnerability (missing CORP-header)
        threshold: off # No risk since the API only serves mobile applications, not browsers.

  # Docs(alertFilter): https://www.zaproxy.org/docs/desktop/addons/alert-filters/automation/
  # FYI: Needs to be run before openapi/activeScan/passiveScan-wait
  # Modify the risk level of specific alerts, or dismiss with False Positive
  - type: alertFilter
    alertFilters:
      # https://www.zaproxy.org/docs/alerts/
      # Disable browser-specific rules
      - ruleId: 90028 # Insecure HTTP Method
        newRisk: False Positive
        url: '.*\/persons\/paymentinstruments$' # No risk since the endpoint is for authenticated accounts.
        urlRegex: true

  # OpenAPI Import: Import API definition from Swagger to understand API structure
  # Docs(openapi): https://www.zaproxy.org/docs/desktop/addons/openapi-support/automation/
  - type: openapi
    parameters:
      apiUrl: https://project.com/openapi.json
  
  # Active Scan: Actively probe the API for vulnerabilities
  # This sends potentially malicious payloads to test endpoints
  # Docs(activeScan): https://www.zaproxy.org/docs/desktop/addons/automation-framework/job-ascan/
  - type: activeScan
    policyDefinition:
      defaultStrength: high # How thorough the scan should be
      defaultThreshold: low
      rules:
        # https://www.zaproxy.org/docs/alerts/
        - id: 10104 # User Agent Fuzzer
          threshold: off
        - id: 10095 # Backup File Disclosure
          threshold: off # Many false positives. Low risk since the tech stack has no backup files on the server.
        - id: 40019 # SQL Injection - MySQL
          threshold: off
        - id: 40020 # SQL Injection - Hypersonic SQL
          threshold: off
        - id: 40021 # SQL Injection - Oracle
          threshold: off
        - id: 40022 # SQL Injection - PostgreSQL
          threshold: off
        - id: 40024 # SQL Injection - SQLite
          threshold: off

  # Docs(passiveScan-wait): https://www.zaproxy.org/docs/desktop/addons/automation-framework/job-pscanwait/
  # Passive scanning analyzes all HTTP requests made by the activeScan without sending additional requests
  - type: passiveScan-wait

  # Docs(report): https://www.zaproxy.org/docs/desktop/addons/report-generation/automation/
  - type: report
    parameters:
      template: modern
      # https://github.com/zaproxy/action-af?tab=readme-ov-file#files
      reportDir: /zap/wrk/zap-reports/modern/

  # This will be added to the GitHub Actions job summary
  # Docs(report): https://www.zaproxy.org/docs/desktop/addons/report-generation/automation/
  - type: report
    parameters:
      template: traditional-md
      # https://github.com/zaproxy/action-af?tab=readme-ov-file#files
      reportDir: /zap/wrk/
      reportFile: zap-report.md

  # Exit Status: Define scan success/failure criteria for CI/CD pipeline
  # This determines if the GitHub Action will pass or fail
  # Docs(exitStatus): https://www.zaproxy.org/docs/desktop/addons/automation-framework/job-exitstatus/
  - type: exitStatus
    parameters:
      warnLevel: medium # Fail if medium or high severity issues are found
      errorLevel: medium
```

**GitHub Action step:**
```yaml
      - name: ZAP Scan
        uses: zaproxy/action-af@4dd5346bd6603523068d5ecbf3a366f57cdc1890 # v0.2.0
        with:
          plan: ./zap-plan.yaml
          docker_name: ghcr.io/zaproxy/zaproxy:nightly
          # https://www.zaproxy.org/addons/
          # https://www.zaproxy.org/docs/desktop/start/features/addons/
          # https://www.zaproxy.org/docs/desktop/cmdline/
          # https://www.zaproxy.org/docs/automate/automation-framework/#updating-add-ons
          cmd_options: >-
            -addonupdate
            -addoninstall ascanrulesAlpha
            -addoninstall ascanrulesBeta
            -addoninstall pscanrulesAlpha
            -addoninstall pscanrulesBeta
        env:
          ZAP_AUTH_HEADER: Authorization-Token
          ZAP_AUTH_HEADER_VALUE: ${{ steps.auth.outputs.token }}
```

</details>

issue.title: Init alert's history ID in all cases

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Initialise the history ID also when creating the `Alert` with the `HistoryReference`.

Fix #8888.
